newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: RESEARCH ALERT - FJ Benjamin recommended by Fraser.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - FJ Benjamin recommended by Fraser.

text.p: Fraser Securities recommended investors to subscribe to the shares of fashion retailer FJ Benjamin Holdings Pte Ltd (FJB) on its strong track record.

Fraser said in a statement made available to Reuters on Thursday that in spite of a retail slump, FJB had managed profit growth of 693 percent over the last three years to S$10.9 million for financial year ended June 1996 from S$1.4 million in June 1993.
Fraser said FJB's success came from effective brand promotion and its establishment as an effective niche player.
It said due to FJB's extensive Asia Pacific network, the company enjoyed economies of scales in purchasing, marketing and communications.
"We are forecasting earnings to grow by about 20 percent annually for the next three years," Fraser said.
Fraser put FJB's prospective price earnings ratio for fiscal 1997 at 12.2 times compared to an historical 11 times on its initial public offer price of Singapore $0.80 each.
FJB launched 50 million shares at an initial public offering in Singapore on Tuesday. The offer will close on November 12 and trading starts on November 14 on a when-issued basis.
